programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live S5
programme.desc: Conversation, advice and great company to make your morning.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: The team investigate the contracts you've signed up for, but which haven't delivered what you expected, including home repair policies that didn't live up to expectations, car insurance that caused headaches instead of peace of mind, and the funeral plans that fell apart. Julia, Angela and Gloria reveal how you can make sure you don't come a cropper too. All that and more in the advice clinic - with problems sorted, and clear and simple tips on how to keep more of your money in your pocket.

programme.title: Fraud Squad S3 (n°4)
programme.desc: Police foil the criminal gang behind an £8 million fake transport ticket fraud.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S26 (28/30)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Burnley and Padiham in Lancashire, and Broadway in Somerset.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine visits Southwell Racecourse, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall find valuable items to sell at auction with Colin Young. Roo learns about a forgotten industry, tin box manufacturing.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors (Cold Call) S24 (n°73)
programme.desc: «Cold Call»Bear is determined to fix things with Claudia, while Zara gets an unexpected message.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S14 (9/20)
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers hopes to rescue some rusty saws, a dressing table and a wooden playhouse.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S22 (54/55)
programme.desc: The King and HM the Queen's other children holding vigil around the coffin of Her Majesty.

programme.title: Garden Rescue S8
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, with an outdated pink and yellow "Battenburg" patio, a tumbledown shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married, and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Desperate for some inspiration, they've asked the team to create a garden fit for the upcoming nuptials, but also a lovely space for mum Nanda, once the wedding is over, all for £3.5K. They would like Charlie and Flo to pick up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting, but most of all they want the gravel slope gone. They'd like generous seating areas and storage, as well as a herb garden for keen cook Nanda. It's a long wish list - can Charlie and Flo deliver?

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It S2 (4/20)
programme.desc: The team are in north London, helping grandmother Maura give her lounge a makeover.

programme.title: Pointless S29
programme.desc: The brainy quiz returns, but this time host Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ria Lina. As always, contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders (n°6708)
programme.desc: George Knight arrives in Walford with his daughters Gina and Anna.

programme.title: MasterChef S19
programme.desc: After eight gruelling weeks of intense competition, the final three return to the MasterChef kitchen for the very last time as the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax. Nothing short of exceptional will cut it. The finalists have one last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and in three hours demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. Tonight, they must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and produce jaw-droppingly good food for the judges. To stand out, they must push themselves to the absolute limit and showcase their very best in what will be the biggest cook-off of their lives. It's now or never, as at the end only one will lift the trophy and become MasterChef Champion 2023.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? (Andrew Lloyd Webber) S20 (n°1)
programme.desc: «Andrew Lloyd Webber»Andrew Lloyd Webber is amazed by family stories that uncannily parallel his own life.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of topical debate.
